section.title: Create interceptors using template-based file generation
section.para: Though the logic of intermediate operations used for interceptor creation is not complex(see ), writing code for that operations by hands is not an easy task. The main reason of this is the lack of typecheking inside the KEDR COI library.

Because the library is intended to use for any objects and callback operations, many essences have very abstract types and definitions. E.g, objects have type 'void*', callback operations identifies by there offsets in the object or operations struct, pointers to callback operations have type 'void*', same for pre- and post-handlers signatures, etc.

But intermediate operation should call interception handlers and original callback operation, so it should actively use typecasts, which make compiler unable to detect incorrectly used types of variables and functions. So, many possible human errors in intermediate operations aren't revealed at the compile phase. Moreover, some of these errors may be revealed at runtime only after a long time of using.

From the other side, a little information is needed for create intermediate operations for particular object type. And this information may be expressed in the terms of concrete types and names - type of the object, names of the callback operations, types and names of their arguments, etc - which is much less error-prone than writing code of intermediate operations. For create code of intermediate operations from such information template-base generator may be used.

KEDR COI has templates suitable for create interceptors using 'kedr_gen' generator. The only thing which should be provided by the user is a 'definition' file contained some information about object's type and its operations. Generator itself and format of definition files are fully described in the documentation of KEDR project (). Templates are placed in the '/usr/local/share/kedr-coi/tepmplates' directory.

section.title: Files generated for interceptor
section.para: Using template kedr_coi_interceptor.h one can create header file for interceptor. This file contains definitions in same format as for predefined interceptors (see ). For create source file with interceptor's implementation, template kedr_coi_interceptor.c should be used.

section.title: Definition file for interceptor
section.para:
Definition file for interceptor should contain definitions for the following parameters:
interceptor.name name of the interceptor, used in its constructor
interceptor.prefix string which will be used as prefix for all exported functions and macros for this interceptor
header includes and other C-code, which contains definition of types and functions used for interceptor
implementation_header Additional includes and other C-code, which used in implementation of intermediate functions.
object.type type of the objects for which instrumentor should be applied
interceptor.is_direct should be not empty for direct interceptor(see ), for indirect instrumentor should be empty or not defined
object.operations_field field in the object struct which is a pointer to the operations structure(only for indirect instrumentor)
operations.type type of the operations structure(only for indirect instrumentor)

For every callback operations, interception of which should be supported, a group should be prepared in the definition file. Each group should contain definitions for the following parameters:
operation.name name of the callback operation, as a field name in the object/operations structure
operation.returnType type returning by this operation; if operation doesn't return value should be empty or isn't defined
operation.arg.type (multi-valued) types of the parameters of the callback operation, starting with the first one
operation.arg.name (multi-valued) names of the parameters of the callback operation, starting with the first one. Parameters will be accessible via these names in the code.
operation.object parameter name or other c-expression returned owner object for this operation call. Names of operation's parameters and global functions and variables may be used in this expression.
operation.default Implementation of the default callback operation. It will be executed in case when pointer to original operation is NULL. Names of operation's parameters and global functions and variables may be used in this code. If this parameter is not defined, NULL pointer to the operation is treated as error.
operation.group_id Number identified operations group. Operations from the same group either are all replaced by intermediates or aren't replaced at all. Grouping is not used if this parameter is 0 or isn't defined. See for example of using this parameter.

section.title: Files generated for foreign interceptor
section.para: Using template kedr_coi_foreign_interceptor.h one can create header file for foreign interceptor. This file contains definitions in same format as for predefined foreign interceptors (see ). For create source file with foreign interceptor's implementation, template kedr_coi_foreign_interceptor.c should be used.

section.title: Definition file for foreign interceptor
section.para:
Definition file for foreign interceptor should contain definitions for the following parameters:
interceptor.name name of the interceptor, used in its constructor
interceptor.prefix string which will be used as prefix for all exported functions and macros for this interceptor
header includes and other C-code, which contains definition of types and functions used for interceptor
implementation_header Additional includes and other C-code, which used in implementation of intermediate functions.
prototype_object.type type of the prototype objects for which foreign instrumentor should be applied
prototype_object.operations_field field in the prototype object struct which is a pointer to the operations structure
operations.type type of the operations structure

For every callback operation which is called just after new object is created a group should be prepared in the definition file. Each group should contain definitions for the following parameters:
operation.name name of the callback operation, as a field name in the operations structure
operation.returnType type returning by this operation; if operation doesn't return value should be empty or isn't defined
operation.arg.type (multi-valued) types of the parameters of the callback operation, starting with the first one
operation.arg.name (multi-valued) names of the parameters of the callback operation, starting with the first one. Parameters will be accessible via these names in the code.
operation.object parameter name or other c-expression returned owner object for this operation call. Names of operation's parameters and global functions and variables may be used in this expression.
operation.prototype_object parameter name or other c-expression returned prototype object. from wich owner object is created. Names of operation's parameters and global functions and variables may be used in this expression.
operation.default Implementation of the default callback operation. It will be executed in case when pointer to chained operation is NULL. Names of operation's parameters and global functions and variables may be used in this code. If this parameter is not defined, NULL pointer to the operation is treated as error.
